isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - FANS AND SHUTTERS - OPERATION - Horton Engine Fan Controls With Caterpillar C-10 And C-12

svcproc.title: Horton Engine Fan Controls With Caterpillar C-10 And C-12
svcproc.para: Horton Fan/Clutch Assembly- The fan clutch is engaged by air pressure supplied by the fan solenoid. The fan clutch is spring loaded off and air pressure is required to overcome the spring and engage the clutch.

Normally Open Fan Solenoid (335) - The N.O. fan solenoid (335) supplies air pressure to engage the fan clutch when the solenoid is not energized. Energizing the solenoid turns off the air pressure to the fan clutch, causing the fan clutch to disengage.

The solenoid receives ignition voltage (key on) on circuit 23 from 5A fuse F2. The solenoid ground circuit, 23B, is connected to the normally open contact of the fan solenoid relay (538). The relay opens and closes, causing the fan solenoid to turn on and off.

Fan Control Relay (538) - The fan solenoid relay control coil is energized by a 12V signal on circuit 23A from ECM connector (400) terminal 28. The relay control coil ground circuit 23-GA is grounded through the engine harness to cylinder head ground.
When the ECM energizes the fan solenoid relay, the N.O. contacts close, completing the circuit to ground for circuit 23B, causing the fan solenoid to energize. This disengages the fan clutch.

The ECM uses inputs from the engine coolant temperature sensor, retarder solenoid status and the A/C high pressure switch (311) to determine when the fan should be on. To turn the fan on, the ECM applies 0V to the fan solenoid relay. To turn the fan off, the ECM applies 12V to the fan solenoid relay.
The ECM turns the fan on under the following conditions:
If the engine speed is less than 2250 RPM or the engine is running and any of the following conditions exists:
Coolant temperature sensor is greater than 96°C (205°F) or
There is an active diagnostic code for the coolant temperature sensor or
The retarder solenoid signal is active (high mode) for more than 10 seconds with coolant temperature sensor greater than 80°C (176°F) or
A/C high pressure switch is open or
There is an active diagnostic code for an open A/C high pressure switch circuit.
The ECM turns the fan off under the following conditions:
Engine speed is greater than 2300 RPM or all of the following conditions exists:
Coolant temperature sensor is less than 92°C (198°F) and
No active coolant temperature sensor diagnostic code and
Retarder solenoid signal is active (high mode) with coolant temperature sensor less than 75°C (167°F) and
A/C high pressure switch is closed and the ECM is not counting (or A/C fan on time is programmed to zero seconds) and
The engine has been running at least two seconds.

note.para: Once the ECM has turned the fan on, the fan will remain on for a minimum of 180 seconds to avoid unnecessary fan clutch cycling (except at engine start-up - it will run for only two seconds after the engine starts). The 180 second time interval is a programmable feature.
